## Community of Practice

-   A community of practice (CoP) is a group of people who share a common concern, a set of problems/interest in a topic.

-   They come together to fulfill both individual and group goals.

-   Provide tools and resources to foster a diverse and friendly and inclusive community of data science learners and practitioners.

    ::: aside
    (Lave and Wenger, 1991) Situated learning: Legitimate peripheral participation. *The Press Syndicate of the University of Cambridge*.

    <https://www.communityofpractice.ca/background/what-is-a-community-of-practice/>
    :::

## Community Involvement Challenges

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
![](science-girl-working-girl.gif)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   No culture of volunteering

-   No continuation of knowledge sharing

-   Difference in communicating

-   Meetups can be inaccessible

-   In-person meetups are hard to attend

-   School/Work commitments
:::
:::

## In The End

-   Communities of Practise help bring novices and experts together though activities.

-   Data Science COPs in Africa have shown to be increasing due to the growing events and chapters.

-   Community involvement can grow your data skills.

-   A sustainable COP means being inclusive, organising team and taking care of yourself.
